before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"1stu","text":"The critical steps are tagged. Steps 5-108 are optional (for troubleshooting).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5mta0","text":"Viral whole genome sequencing (WGS) has been instrumental in outbreak investigations, deployment of public health interventions, development as well as evaluation of vaccines and therapeutics. While multiple methods are commercially available for WGS, multiplex amplicon method has proven to be faster, more efficient, scalable, and more cost-effective compared to other methods. Here, we describe the automation of a multiplex amplicon panel for WGS of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus-2 (SARS-CoV-2), the causative agent of the current COVID-19 pandemic. The SWIFT Biosciences' primer set amplifies 345 amplicons designed against the SARS-CoV-2 Wuhan-Hu-1 complete genome (NC_045512.2),  in a single tube to cover the ~30 kb SARS-CoV-2 genome in less than three hours. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: whole genome sequencing, SARS-CoV-2, SWIFT Biosciences,PerkinElmer,automation,genome
